SENT.plain: Idiopathic ventricular fibrillation (VF) is defined as spontaneous VF in the absence of structural heart disease
No prior reports exist addressing the technical aspects of idiopathic VF ablation in a child
We present the case of a 10-year-old boy with idiopathic VF, who presented a unique management challenge, particularly as regards the technical aspects of the ablation procedure
Ablation of idiopathic VF is feasible in a 10-year-old boy and oral quinidine seems more effective than other antiarrhythmic drugs in this condition
